Calling all outdoor enthusiasts: REI’s Labor Day Sale is live. Now through Sept. 1, you can score discounts on camping and hiking gear, sneakers, apparel and more. Many of the best deals are on REI’s in-house brand, but we’ve also found great offers from well-known brands like Yeti and Osprey, as well as discounts on some of our editors’ favorite products—like the Ghost Max 2 Road-Running Shoes (our pick for the best standing and walking shoe) and the Darn Tough Hiker Crew Socks (our pick for the best hiking socks).
There’s also a special perk for REI Co-op members: Code LABORDAY2025 gets you an extra 20% off one REI Outlet item. (If you’re not a member, a lifetime membership costs a one-time $30 fee, so it may be worthwhile to sign up before purchasing a bigger-ticket item.) Below, our deals editors rounded up the best REI Labor Day deals for easier browsing.
Save 25% On Our Pick For The Best Closed-Toe Hiking Sandal
Keen Newport H2 Sandals (Men's)
This Keen shoe is our gear editors’ favorite closed-toe hiking sandal and their favorite water shoe. The design is breezy and lightweight but durable enough to protect your feet on the trails. Its platform sole also makes it exceedingly comfortable if you need to tack on the miles. You can also the women’s version on sale for the same price.
Take 36% Off This Supportive Running Shoe
Saucony Tempus Road-Running Shoes (Men's)
If speed is your goal on your daily runs, this road-running shoe was built to move quickly and keep up. It brings a springy ride and responsive energy return with every step, while its form-fitting, contouring design offers a personalized fit to deliver support across every area of your foot. REI members can save an extra 25% with code LABORDAY2025.
This Best-Selling Trail-Running Design Is 25% Off
Altra Timp 5 Trail-Running Shoes (Women's)
Trail running shoes should be comfortable and durable, provide excellent traction and hold up against changing terrain. Altra makes our editors’ favorite trail running shoe for wide feet. While the Timp 5 isn’t the same model, the design is still known for a roomy toe box and comes backed by the American Podiatric Medical Association (APMA) Seal of Acceptance.
Save 25% On This On Trail Running Shoe
On Cloudsurfer Trail Trail-Running Shoes (Women's)
Another reliable trail running shoe, the On Cloudsurfer can hold up against varying terrain with ease, including both wet and dry conditions. It features On’s Helion superfoam and CloudTec Phase technology to relieve pressure on your joints, and a sturdy rubber outsole to keep you steady on your feet.
Enjoy 25% Off This Pair Of Sneakers From One Of Our Favorite Brands
La Sportiva Prodigio Trail-Running Shoes (Women's)
When it comes to trail running shoes, La Sportiva makes some of our favorite pairs. They are a great option for anyone seeking reliable traction and stability, especially on varying terrain. This pair offers a breathable, quick-drying and cushioned design. Right now, three different colors are discounted for Labor Day. Just keep in mind, the brand recommends ordering half a size up.
If you’re a seasoned hiker who plans to tackle intermediate trails this fall, consider grabbing a pair of these durable, sturdy boots. They offer long-lasting cushioning, outsoles with high-traction grip and will shield your feet from whatever you may encounter on your path, including streams and mud.
Get 19% Off These Sneakers, Which Have The APMA Seal Of Acceptance
Brooks Ghost Max 2 Road-Running Shoes (Women's)
After testing numerous pairs of sneakers and consulting with podiatrists, our team named the Brooks Ghost Max 2 as one of the best shoes for standing all day, especially on hard surfaces like concrete. These ultra-cushioned sneakers provide a plush, soft ride and a rocker for smooth heel-to-toe transitions. Right now, you can get 19% off these sneakers in four colors (for the women’s pair) and five colors (for the men’s pair).
Save 26% On A Fall-Ready Pair Of Hiking Boots
Merrell Moab 3 Mid Hiking Boots (Women's)
Merrell’s hiking boots are already fairly budget-friendly, but you can get them for even less during REI’s Labor Day sale. The over-the-ankle design makes them extra stable and protects you from brush and other obstacles you may encounter on the trail. If you’re an REI member, you can save an extra 20% at checkout with code LABORDAY2025.
Get These Lightweight Trail Sandals For 25% Off
Teva Universal Trail Sandals (Men's)
Our gear editor named the Teva Universal Trail Sandal the best budget hiking sandals because of their secure hook-and-loop straps, lightly cushioned midsole and grippy rubber outsole. While these sandals may not stand the test of time like more expensive pairs, they’re great for mellow hikes and daily walks. All three colorways are on sale (and the women’s version is as well), and REI members can get an extra 20% off by using code LABORDAY2025.
Best REI Labor Day Deals: Apparel
Take 25% Off Our Favorite Men's Outdoor Travel Pants
Prana Stretch Zion Pant (Men's)
This rugged pant is great for outdoor adventures, like hiking and camping. Gear editor Cameron Vigliotta loves this design because "it’s loose through the leg, a little stretchy, UPF 50+ rated and outfitted with handy pockets for travel essentials.”
This Best-Selling Mountain Hardwear Hoodie Is 25% Off
Mountain Hardwear Crater Lake Long-Sleeve Hoody (Women's)
This hoodie has a minimalist aesthetic but tons of useful features, including a quick-drying fabric, UPF 50+ protection, a zip pocket, thumb holes and adjustable drawcord ties. It’s also made with a buttery soft fabric and a flatseam design to keep you comfortable all day long.
Stock Up On Our Pick For The Best Hiking Socks Overall For 25% Less
Darn Tough Hiker Micro Crew Socks (Men's)
Our favorite hiking sock is durable enough to last for years, moisture-wicking and odor-resistant. It also has elastic support around the arch and comes with a lifetime warranty. In short, you’d be hard-pressed to find a better foot companion. It’s made mostly from merino wool, so it fits like a cozy sweater and will help keep you warm as the weather cools.
These Top-Rated UPF 50 Shorts Are Under $30 Right Now
REI Co-op Active Pursuits Shorts
Whether you’re sporting these shorts during casual outings or workouts, you can bet you’ll stay comfortable. The moisture-wicking and quick drying shorts feature a 4-way stretch, an elastic waistband and adjustable drawstring for easy and secure movement. They are available in six colors and six sizes, however, stock differs by color selection.
Score This Editor-Approved Jacket For Less Than $100
The North Face Alta Vista Rain Jacket (Women's)
Our deals and coupons writer Bianca Alvarez has been using this lightweight rain jacket for years; she loves how effective it is at keeping her dry in light and heavy rain. In addition to its water-resistant material, it features adjustable hook-and-loop cuff tabs, cinch cords at the hem and a hood. It also has the ability to zip all the way up the neck to prevent water from entering.
Take 25% Off These Pants With UPF 50 Sun Protection
Mountain Hardwear Dynama Pants (Women's)
You’ll get plenty of use out of these versatile pants during camping and hiking season. They’re made of a lightweight nylon and spandex fabric that you can easily move in, and feature UPF 50 sun protection and anti-odor properties.

Vuori Sunday Element Track Jacket (Men's)
This casual, comfortable jacket can be styled numerous ways, whether you’re running errands or heading to the gym. It’s also made with a moisture-wicking material and performance stretch knit fabric, so you won’t overheat or feel suffocated. It’s currently on sale in three colors and six sizes.
This classic bomber combines function with comfort. It’s lightweight so you don’t feel too bundled up, but still heavily insulated (the hand-warmer pockets are insulated too) and water-repellent to keep you warm and dry during those harsher winter months. It comes in four colors, all of which are on sale through Monday.

Brooks High Point Long-Sleeve Shirt (Women's)
The weather may be cooling down, but that doesn’t mean you have to take your runs indoors just yet. This transition piece from Brooks keeps you warm while wicking away sweat. The fitted silhouette makes layering more comfortable and the high neckline works well with a hydration vest. Right now, you can get it for just under $50.

Take 25% Off Our Favorite Camp Chair For Multiple People
Kelty Low Loveseat
This loveseat design is perfect for curling up with your camping partner or pet. It’s comfortable, can support up to 400 pounds and comes with useful features, like adjustable armrests and insulated beverage holders. The chair also includes its own tote storage bag, so it’s easier to cart around. Still, it’s a bulky addition to your camping gear, so it’s best suited for car camping versus a backcountry trek.

This self-inflating bed is designed to fit in a car but it can also be used outside. It offers four inches of open-cell foam and can accommodate two sleepers. This set comes with a repair kit, stuff sack and manual pump.

It comes in two different sizes, both of which are currently discounted in three colorways.

Set Vs. Solo Purchases
Buying a washer and dryer set can be convenient, especially if you’re redoing your laundry room or outfitting a new home. But it’s not always necessary to replace both at once. “There is no reason to replace a working appliance,” says Lewis. “If the units are side by side, you could mix them—but not if you need them to be stacked.” Consider how your setup affects compatibility before committing to a full set.
Front-Load Vs. Top-Load
Both front- and top-loading machines have their pros and cons. “Front-load washers generally have a larger capacity, but top-loaders are quickly catching up,” says Lewis. The right fit often comes down to preference and comfort. “Both types use different muscles to load and unload,” he adds. “Try them in the store and see what works best for your body type.” Also think about layout: front-load machines can be stacked to save space, while top-load models are easier to load without bending over.
Size And Fit
Before you fall in love with a machine online, make sure it’ll physically fit in your space. Modern washers and dryers are packed with high-tech extras: smartphone controls, steam cycles, auto-dispensing detergent and more. Laundry day is a chore, but the right machines can make it a little less laborious. Whereas an unreliable washer can leave you with clothes that are damp or pilled, the best washing machines get your clothes clean in a safe and timely manner. If you’d prefer a top-load model or perhaps something that’s a little more budget-friendly, though, there are plenty of other great washing machines that can help make laundry day a breeze.
“When you’re in the market for a washing machine, it’s ultimately important to find one that best fits your lifestyle,” says Mallory Micetich, home expert at Angi. To help ensure you bring home one that makes sense for your household, start by considering the model’s capacity and wash cycles, both of which can make a difference in how seamless laundry day is for you. Additionally, smart features like the ability to control your washer from your phone might appeal to you if you’re often on the go; if you tend to be home often and can easily access your machine when the need strikes, those extra features might be an unnecessary cost. While doing laundry will likely never be your favorite day, investing in a high-quality washing machine (and a top-notch electric dryer) can help make it slightly more enjoyable. Ahead, here are the best models on the market right now.
Why Trust Forbes Vetted

We also make sure to consult relevant experts whenever we’re researching a category. For this story, we reached out to Mallory Micetich, home expert at Angi, and JustAnswer home and appliance pro Aaron Wilson. Lastly, we regularly revisit this story to review product choices and update pricing; it was last updated in February 2024.
How We Chose The Best Washing Machines
To determine the best washing machines on the market, we started by speaking with two appliance experts for their input on what separates a high-quality washer from one that’s unreliable. We then tracked down the most popular models on the market and narrowed the field based on features like capacity, cycle settings and value. One washing machine, the Maytag Smart Top-Load Washer, was tested by one of our contributors. Lastly, we took customer reviews into consideration to see how these washers have held up for a wide variety of users.
What To Look For In A Washing Machine
The best washing machine for your household ultimately depends on your personal needs, space allotment, budget and preference of features. Keep these in mind during your search.
Capacity
A washer’s capacity is the amount of laundry it can hold in one load, and it’s measured in cubic feet. Many washers are around 4.5 cubic feet, which is a great size for most families. However, larger households may want to consider a washer with a capacity that’s 5 cubic feet or larger. If you have a smaller household or don’t mind doing several loads, a washer that’s 2.5 or so cubic feet can still handle your needs without hogging a lot of your designated laundry area.
Features
Today’s washers tend to have plenty of features their older counterparts never had. Those include options like steam cleaning to really lift away stubborn dirt, reversible doors and smart technology to help sense how dirty your clothes actually are. Some washers even have WiFi connectivity to allow you to monitor and control your loads from your phone. Keep in mind that, in most circumstances, the more features a washer has, the higher the cost. So if you don’t think you’ll need or use them, it may be better to opt for a product with fewer features.
Cycles
Wash cycles give you options beyond just getting your clothes clean. Most washers have the standard normal, permanent press, heavy duty and delicates cycles, but some washing machines offer additional elements that appeal to a certain user. Consider sanitizing cycles to get rid of bacteria that may be lurking on your wardrobe along with allergen removal to specially weed out pollen and other triggers that could be embedded in your clothes. Some models also feature steam cycles to help get a deeper clean and lift away stains.
Energy Efficiency
Energy efficiency can make a difference in your utility bill. Washers that are energy efficient are designed to use less water than others (and heat less water), requiring less energy in the process. In fact, Energy Star–certified products use about 20% less energy and 30% less water, according to the program (which is run by the Environmental Protection Agency and Department of Energy). Consider that when shopping for a new machine—it may be worth it to raise your budget slightly to ensure you get savings over time.
Which Is The Most Reliable Washing Machine Brand?
There are a lot of washing machine brands that are reliable, and they’re generally the home appliance companies that you’re already familiar with. For example, LG, GE, Samsung, Miele and Electrolux are known for delivering quality washers that last. Our top pick is the LG Turbowash Front-Load Washer, which is packed with features with a price tag that isn’t overwhelming. However, there are a range of reliable washers on our list to consider, too.
Are Front Loading Washing Machines Better Than Top Loading Machines?
One isn’t necessarily better than the other—it just depends on your needs. Still, front load washing machines are increasingly popular, and for a few reasons. “They are gentler on your clothes and bedding, so they will last longer,” says JustAnswer home and appliance expert Aaron Wilson. “Front load washers use less water as well. Also, they are great for people with disabilities since you don’t have to reach down inside the unit from the top.” A downside, though, is that they tend to cost more than top loaders. “Top loaders are typically cheaper than front load washers and the newer style of top load washers that don’t have the conventional agitator in the middle of the tub are much gentler on the clothes and bedding than previous top loaders,” Wilson says. “Top loaders also have an advantage for taller people as you don’t have to bend down as you do with a front loader.”
What Are Some Of The Essential Features To Look For In A Washing Machine?
It depends on what is important to you. “I recommend considering a washing machine’s capacity as well as some of the upgraded features newer models have like pre-treating options, load weight sensing and balancing,” Micetich says. Wilson also suggests looking for advance cycles like sanitizing wash, steam clean and ones targeted for activewear. “Also, a great cycle to look for is a clean cycle—that way you can use washing machine cleaner tablets to keep your unit clean and running well,” he says. No matter what machine you buy, Wilson shares this important advice: “Always have a surge protector for your washing machine. Today’s washing machines rely heavily on electronic control boards and drive boards. You can protect them with a surge protector.”
